Package ohos.aafwk.ability

Interface LifecycleStateObserver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ILifecycleObserver

    public interface LifecycleStateObserver
extends ILifecycleObserver
    Observes specific lifecycle events and responds to lifecycle changes.

    Lifecycle dispatches a lifecycle change event to a registered LifecycleStateObserver. LifecycleStateObserver observes lifecycle changes, and onStateChanged(ohos.aafwk.ability.Lifecycle.Event,ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) is called back to process lifecycle change events. Same as LifecycleObserver, the LifecycleStateObserver interface can also implement lifecycle callbacks for Ability and AbilitySlice. LifecycleStateObserver is more suitable to act as the observer of a specific lifecycle event. For example, ActiveData can use this interface to observe lifecycle changes of an ability or ability slice. The system stops notifying LifecycleStateObserver when the ability or ability slice enters the BACKGROUND state and resumes the notification when the state changes to ACTIVE.

    You can call Lifecycle#addObserver(ILifecycleObserver) to register a LifecycleStateObserver with Lifecycle. The onStateChanged(ohos.aafwk.ability.Lifecycle.Event,ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) method is called back after the callback methods in Ability and AbilitySlice.

    LifecycleStateObserver is more flexible than LifecycleObserver. It can observe changes of all lifecycle states or a specific state. You are advised to use LifecycleStateObserver as the observer to observe state changes in both the foreground and background.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    Lifecycle, ILifecycleObserver, LifecycleObserver
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Aafwk#ABILITY

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void onStateChanged​(Lifecycle.Event event, Intent intent)
      Called back in response to a lifecycle change.

    • Method Detail

      • onStateChanged

        void onStateChanged​(Lifecycle.Event event,
                    Intent intent)
        Called back in response to a lifecycle change. This method is triggered by a registered LifecycleStateObserver each time the lifecycle state changes.
        Parameters:
        event - Indicates the lifecycle event.
        intent - Indicates the state change information.
